quest.name: An Old Friend
journal: By all rights you should be departing for the Crystarium, but Y'shtola does not seem ready to return.
objectives: Speak with Asgeir and obtain a well-worn broom.
Take the well-worn broom to Y'shtola.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: So long as we Viis live, we shall preserve the truth of your deeds.

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: In the short time we've known you, it feels as though we've experienced a lifetime of adventures. Adventures we are not like to forget.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Perhaps we should create a new mural in your honor, and as a record for future generations. What do you think?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Although we learned naught of the Ascians, the insight we gained into the Echo made our trip worthwhile.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Before we return to the Crystarium, however, there is a small matter I would attend to in Slitherbough. Might I trouble you to come with me?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Thank you. After we arrive, we should have a brief word with Runar.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Runar appears to be in characteristically high spirits.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Forename! It is so good to see you!

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: You've arrived at a most opportune time. I was preparing a pot of my famous stew. Come, I will ready a place for you.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, Runar, but we haven't the─

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Please, I insist! It will take only a minute.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: <sigh> My apologies, Forename. It seems our return to the Crystarium will be delayed.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But perhaps only for a bit─if you assist me with my work.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I say “work,” but it is rather more a chore. I must clean my chambers here in Slitherbough from top to bottom. If you would be so kind as to go and fetch a broom from Asgeir, we might finish before Runar is done cooking.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I require a broom if I'm to make any meaningful progress here. I'm sure you can find one if you speak with Asgeir.

dialogue.name: ASGEIR
dialogue.text: A broom for...Master Matoya...?

dialogue.name: ASGEIR
dialogue.text: I cannot imagine why she would have need of such a thing, but here you are. It is old but sturdy and sure to suffice.

dialogue.name: ASGEIR
dialogue.text: You don't suppose she might be cleaning, do you? ...Should we be concerned?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I trust Asgeir was able to find a broom for us?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Well worn. Good. This would prove difficult otherwise.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Though I must say, I think I did rather well for not having a broom thus far.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Yes, well, you weren't buried beneath a veritable avalanche of books when you entered, were you? Right. Anyway, it is time I finished cleaning with the help of that broom.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You didn't honestly think I'd do it the old-fashioned way? That broom is more than capable of sweeping by itself. Or rather, it will be... Ahem.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text:
Time to rise, to swish and sweep,
A tidy chamber you must keep.
To this task you shall be bound,
Until no dust is to be found.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: In this one particular respect, I've no objections to following in Master Matoya's footsteps.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Y'shtola-)In future, I may need you to remind me the pursuit of knowledge does not preclude other equally important duties... Such as maintaining clean quarters for said pursuit.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Y'shtola-)<sigh> I will dearly miss this place. These people...

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: (-Runar-)M-Master Matoya! Pardon the interruption, but the stew is ready.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Is something troubling you? You've been rather quiet.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: N-No! Everything is fine, I assure you. It has been a long day, is all.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I see...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-???-)Y'shtola! Thank goodness you're still here.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Alphinaud? I thought you were following Ardbert.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I was, though I'm sad to say I lost track of him shortly after entering these woods.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: He seems determined to traverse every ilm of Norvrandt in his quest to spread the truth of the Warriors of Light and the Flood.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And it seems news of your address at the Crystarium precedes him at every destination, making his task all the more simple.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It remains to be seen to what end he encourages the people to become Warriors of Light themselves...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...But there is no denying that his words have struck a chord with many.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, we're all agreed that this is just another Ascian ploy, yes?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: They've commandeered corpses before, and to no good end. I see no reason to think this time is any different─especially when it's that of a fallen Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I doubt we'll learn more if we remain a step behind.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: His next destination is, in all likelihood, Slitherbough...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Alisaie, are you certain you should be here?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If you're concerned about Halric and the others, you needn't be. Their treatment is going well, but progress is slow and exhausting─for all of us. The best thing I can do now is let them rest. So─I believe we were about to discuss how to arrange a meeting with our would-be Warrior of Light?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Before visiting any towns or villages, Ardbert would hunt down and slay a nearby sin eater to earn the locals' trust.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Our best chance of getting ahead of him is to find one before he does.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thankfully, Thancred and Ryne are returned from the Empty and have taken up the search.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ryne believeth one may lurk beneath the boughs of Woven Oath.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Then that is where we will start our search.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Master Matoya!

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: I...er... A warm bowl of stew will be awaiting your return.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I look forward to it.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Please, Forename, I beg of you... Keep her safe...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I can sense no other sin eaters in the area. I hope this means Ardbert will be coming this way soon.
